src:
√òkonomiske problemer for amerikansk Equinor-partner
Equinors amerikanske gasspartner Chesapeake er i alvorlige √∏konomiske problemer. Analytiker frykter at Equinor skal kj√∏pe enda mer i USA.
07 Nov 2019, 07:46 by Pernille Filippa Pettersen
Chesapeake skriver selv i en melding til det amerikanske finanstilsynet Securities and Exchange Commission at det er tvil om selskapet kan overleve som selskap om de lave prisene p√• gass i markedet opprettholdes. Det var Dagens N√¶ringsliv som f√∏rst omtalte saken.
Denne uken falt aksjen med 20 prosent tirsdag og 27 prosent onsdag. Fallet de siste to dagen er det st√∏rste noensinne for selskapet.
Aksjefall
Det var i 2008 at Equinor (da Statoil) gikk inn i gassfeltet Marcellus gjennom en allianse med Chesapeake Energy Corporation. Marcellus er et av tre hovedomr√•der for Equinor p√• land i USA. De andre omr√•dene er Bakken i Nord-Dakota og Eagle Ford i Texas. I Marcellus utvinnes det gass, mens det er olje i de to andre.
Transaksjonen ble gjort etter at Chesapeake hadde havnet i store √∏konomiske problemer. Etter avtalen som ble gjort i 2008 er Chesapeake Equinors samarbeidspartner i utvinningen av gass p√• land i USA.


Kart over hvor Equinor (da Statoil) er operat√∏r eller partner.üì∑ Skjermdump

‚Äì Ikke naturlig
Equinor √∏nsker ikke √• kommentere utviklingen hos selskapets amerikanske partner til DN.
‚Äì Det er ikke naturlig for oss √• kommentere p√• meldinger som er sendt ut fra andre selskaper. Produksjon fra feltene hvor Equinor er partner med Chesapeake g√•r som normalt, sier pressetalsmann Erik Haaland i Equinor.


Marcellus, et enormt skifergassfelt som strekker seg gjennom fire delstater. Equinor har i samarbeid med Chesapeake betydelige interesser p√• Marcellus-feltet.üì∑ Jon Ingemundsen

Frykter store tap
Oljeanalytiker John Olaisen i meglerhuset ABG Sundal Collier, sier til DN at han frykter at Equinor skal bruke Chesapeakes problemer til √• kj√∏pe seg enda mer i eiendeler p√• land i USA. Han mener det vil v√¶re en d√•rlig ide da Equinors olje- og gassinvesteringer p√• land i USA har v√¶rt alt for d√•rlige.
Bel√∏pene Equinor har tapt p√• investeringer p√• land i USA er store. Til sammen har selskapet skrevet ned sine investeringer med 9,2 milliarder dollar, n√¶rmere 85 milliarder kroner.
text:
Financial Problems for American Equinor Partner
Equinor's US gas partner Chesapeake is in serious financial trouble. Analysts fear Equinor will buy even more in the US.
07 Nov 2019, 07:46 by Pernille Filippa Pettersen
Chesapeake even writes in a statement to the US Securities and Exchange Commission that there is doubt as to whether the company can survive as a company if the low gas prices in the market are maintained. It was Dagens N√¶ringsliv that first mentioned the case.
This week the stock fell by 20 percent on Tuesday and 27 percent on Wednesday. The fall over the past two days is the biggest ever for the company.
Share Fall
It was in 2008 that Equinor (then Statoil) entered the Marcellus gas field through an alliance with the Chesapeake Energy Corporation. Marcellus is one of three main areas for Equinor onshore in the United States. The other areas are Bakken in North Dakota and Eagle Ford in Texas. In Marcellus, gas is extracted, while there is oil in the other two.
The transaction was made after Chesapeake had major financial problems. Following the agreement made in 2008, Chesapeake Equinor is a partner in the extraction of onshore gas in the United States.


Map of where Equinor (then Statoil) is the operator or partner.üì∑ Screenshot

- Not natural
Equinor does not want to comment on the development of the company's US partner to DN.
- It is not natural for us to comment on messages sent from other companies. Production from the fields where Equinor is a partner with Chesapeake goes as normal, says Equinor press spokesman Erik Haaland.


Marcellus, a huge shale gas field that extends through four states. Equinor, in collaboration with Chesapeake, has significant interests in the Marcellus field.üì∑ Jon Ingemundsen

Fear big losses
Oil analyst John Olaisen at the brokerage ABG Sundal Collier says to DN that he fears Equinor will use Chesapeake's problems to buy even more in land assets in the US. He thinks it will be a bad idea as Equinor's oil and gas investments on land in the US have been too bad.
The amounts Equinor has lost on land investments in the United States are large. In total, the company has written down its investments by $ 9.2 billion, nearly NOK 85 billion.
